Även Allmänna arvsfonden och Den offentliga omställningsorganisationen finns hos oss. Trots uppdragens variation har de gemensamt att det krävs både bredd och spetskompetens för att utföra dem. På Kammarkollegiet arbetar cirka 350 personer – framför allt jurister, ekonomer och kvalificerade handläggare. Myndigheten finns i Stockholm, Karlstad och Härnösand.

title: Saab söker erfarna ingenjörer inom mjukvara!
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*

Din roll


För oss är teknik mer än kod och mekanik. Det är hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Det som utmanar oss, inspirerar oss och håller oss engagerade. Du kommer att vara involverad under hela produktens livscykel, från design och kodning till testning och implementering – samtidigt som du tillsammans med ditt team är en viktig pusselbit i vår resa mot att skapa nästa generations försvarssystem.


Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du kommer att få möjlighet att utvecklas och växa som utvecklare. Du kommer att vara del av ett agilt team som stöttar dig och din personliga utveckling. Denna roll innebär samarbete, inte bara med dina närmaste kollegor, utan även till andra avdelningar, leverantörer och kunder.


Din profil


För att trivas på Saab tror du på en kultur av nyfikenhet, tillit och lagarbete. Det spelar ingen roll om du är i början av din karriär eller är expert inom ditt område, det viktigaste är att du delar vår passion för utveckling och ny spännande teknik!


Som en del av vårt team kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta med de senaste verktygen och teknologierna inom branschen. Vi söker dig med kunskap och erfarenhet inom bland annat programmeringsspråk och verktyg såsom Python, C, C++, C# och .NET. Erfarenhet av hårdvarunära programmering, AI och maskininlärning är meriterande.


Vi arbetar även med moderna utvecklingsverktyg och tekniska plattformar som Git, DevOps och Jira. Våra team är mångsidiga, och vi tror på att olika perspektiv och erfarenheter bidrar till att skapa ännu bättre lösningar. Oavsett din tidigare arbetsbakgrund är du varmt välkommen att vara med och forma framtidens teknologi!


På vårt kontor i Karlskoga erbjuder vi en bred variation av spännande roller inom mjukvara. Oavsett om du är *mjukvaruutvecklare, mjukvaruingenjör, testledare, applikationsingenjör, cybersäkerhetsingenjör eller testingenjör*, finns det möjligheter för dig att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss!


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Det du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 23 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Test Manager
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Plan and oversee the test activities for the Internal and external stream.
* Execute predefined testing, including API testing and other critical validation processes.
* Use Jira/XRAY and Confluence for documentation, tracking, and collaboration.
* Drive proactive test planning and execution, maintaining high quality across deliverables.
* Coordinate test activities between assigned project and other streams/project for seamless integration.
* Provide strategic advisor on testing best practices and quality assurance.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* You have proven experience in technical test management methodologies.
* You have experience in API and Network (Radius/Roaming) testing, and troubleshooting experience in telecom/NW.
* You have strong hands-on expertise in Jira and Confluence for test management.
* Your communication and leadership skills to drive alignment across stakeholders.
* You are highly proactive and organized.
* Your mindset is equally important as your technical skill.
* Experience with Wireshark and osix tools can be an advantage.
* Knowledge in telecom technologies like Radio Access Network (RAN), Mobile Core (4G, 5G, 5GNSA) are highly appreciated.


To succeed in this role, strong communication skills are essential for engaging with stakeholders, proactively managing testing activities, and coordinating tasks across multiple projects and external vendors in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. A problem-solving mindset, sharp analytical thinking, and the ability to perform well under pressure are key to success.

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 30-05-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  


  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Network Automation Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced **Senior Network Automation Engineer** to lead the evolution of a global, high-performance network infrastructure supporting low-latency trading environments. This role blends deep networking expertise with modern automation practices to ensure scalability, resilience, and operational efficiency across multiple international data centers.

#### **What You’ll Do:**

* Redesign and modernize network architecture to improve performance and fault tolerance.
* Automate network deployment and configuration using tools like **Ansible, Terraform, and Python**.
* Build and optimize **private VPLS/eVPN** connectivity across global data centers, offices, and cloud providers.
* Implement observability solutions to monitor network health and troubleshoot complex issues using packet analysis.
* Collaborate with internal teams and clients to deliver tailored network solutions that align with business needs.
* Ensure compliance with **ISO 27001** and other security standards.
* Manage system updates, documentation, and contribute to infrastructure CI/CD processes using **Git**.

#### **What We’re Looking For:**

* 5+ years of experience in network engineering.
* Strong knowledge of **BGP, OSPF, MPLS, VXLAN**, and other routing protocols.
* Hands-on experience with enterprise network gear (Cisco, Arista, Fortinet).
* Proficiency in **Python**, **Terraform**, and **Ansible** for infrastructure automation.
* Understanding of **cloud networking** (AWS, Azure, GCP) and **SDN technologies**.
* Experience in **high-availability, low-latency** environments is a strong advantage.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.
* Industry certifications such as **CCNA/CCNP** are a plus.

#### **Nice to Have:**

* Experience with **FreeBSD**, **Precision Time Protocols**, or **virtualization platforms** (VMware, Hyper-V).
* Exposure to DevOps culture and CI/CD practices.

#### **Why Join Us:**

* **High-impact work**: Drive automation and modernization across a mission-critical global network.
* **Global reach**: Contribute to infrastructure spanning multiple data centers and cloud regions.
* **Growth & ownership**: Influence architecture, standards, and tools in a nimble environment with clear career progression.
* **Collaboration & innovation**: Work closely with cross-functional teams and explore emerging technologies.
* **Fast Hiring process**: Technical interview with CTO and Final Interview.

title: Kravanalytiker - Sundsvall
description:
### **Kravanalytiker med teknisk testkompetens – agilt leveransteam**


Vi söker en strukturerad och lösningsorienterad kravanalytiker med teknisk förståelse och erfarenhet av systemtestning för ett långsiktigt utvecklingsuppdrag i en agil miljö. I denna roll får du en central funktion i ett utvecklingsteam med stort ansvar, där du bidrar i hela kedjan från kravanalys till test och leverans.


Uppdraget är en del av ett strategiskt initiativ för att vidareutveckla och förvalta digitala lösningar som stödjer organisationens långsiktiga mål. Teamet arbetar enligt moderna, iterativa arbetssätt där kvalitet, tillgänglighet och säkerhet står i fokus.

### **Ansvarsområden**


Som kravanalytiker i ett agilt team kommer du att:

* Arbeta nära verksamheten för att samla in och omsätta behov till strukturerade och testbara krav
* Använda metoder som acceptanskriterier och scenario-baserad nedbrytning för att skapa inkrementellt värde
* Formulera tydliga kravbilder kring integrationer med externa aktörer, särskilt med fokus på hög IT-säkerhet
* Delta i utvecklingen av användargränssnitt för både interna och externa användare
* Säkerställa spårbarhet från krav till verifiering/test

### **Testansvar**


Du kommer även att ha en viktig roll i teamets testarbete, med ansvar för att:

* Planera och genomföra tekniska tester såsom system- och integrationstest
* Arbeta med testautomatisering samt testdriven och beteendedriven utveckling (TDD/BDD)
* Utföra tillgänglighetstester enligt WCAG
* Hantera SQL-frågor för att verifiera datakvalitet och logik
* Säkerställa testbarhet och tydlig dokumentation av systemkrav

### **Arbetssätt och miljö**

* Agil leveransmodell med stort teamansvar
* Iterativt arbetssätt inspirerat av SAFe
* Fokus på kontinuerlig integration och leverans (CI/CD)
* Tätt samarbete med utvecklare, produktägare och andra roller i teamet
* Betoning på förbättringsarbete, automation och kvalitetssäkring

### **Använda verktyg och tekniker**

* **Krav & test:** Jira, Xray, Confluence, Balsamiq
* **Testautomation & API:** Cypress, Cucumber, Gherkin, Insomnia
* **Versionshantering & DevOps:** GitLab
* **Databas:** SQL

### **Din profil**


Vi söker dig som:

* Har erfarenhet som kravanalytiker och testare i agila utvecklingsmiljöer
* Är van att arbeta med tekniska krav och integrationer
* Har god kunskap om tillgänglighetskrav och säkerhetsaspekter i IT-lösningar
* Har erfarenhet av testautomatisering och gärna testdriven utveckling
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska i tal och skrift
* Är noggrann, analytisk och samarbetsorienterad

### **Om uppdraget**

* **Start:** Oktober 2025
* **Slut:** September 2027, med möjlighet till förlängning till 2028
* **Omfattning:** Heltid
* **Placering:** Sundsvall, arbete sker på plats

 **Om Rasulson Consulting**  

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Databricks Champion
description:
***At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 800 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!***  

  

**Your role**

**We are now seeking a passionate and experienced** **Databricks Expert or Champion** **to join our dynamic team in Stockholm or Gothenburg. In this role, you will play a key part in driving Capgemini’s data, analytics & AI strategy forward using the Databricks platform. You will work hands-on with the latest tools in data ingestion, ETL, orchestration, and machine learning, while also contributing to solution design, architecture, and customer engagement. This is a role for someone who thrives at the intersection of technology, strategy, and communication.**  

  

**Capgemini has a strong and close collaboration with Databricks and was named EMEA Partner of the Year 2024 – a recognition of our customer growth, joint engagements, and technical excellence. As part of our team, you’ll help strengthen this partnership and guide organizations in unlocking the full potential of the Databricks platform.**  

  

***In this role you will play a key part in:***  

  



* **Design and implement high-performance data pipelines using Databricks and Apache Spark**
* **Build and maintain secure data lakehouses and data warehouses in Azure**
* **Integrate AI/ML models into data pipelines using Databricks ML and Azure ML**
* **Lead solutioning and architecture efforts – from whiteboard to production**
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data scientists, analysts, and DevOps engineers**
* **Participate in presales, technical workshops, and customer presentations**

**#LI-AKARLSS**

**Your profile**  

**We believe you are a senior data engineer or architect with a passion for building scalable, high-impact data solutions. You combine deep technical skills with strong communication and solutioning capabilities.**  

  

**You have:**  

  



* **Proven experience designing and implementing data platforms using Databricks, Apache Spark, SQL, and Python**
* **Several years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure, including services like Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, and Azure ML**
* **A solid understanding of data architecture, including lakehouse design, data modeling, and governance**
* **Experience working in presales, technical workshops, and customer-facing presentations**
* **A collaborative mindset and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions**

  

**Databricks Champion – or on your way there**

**We are looking for someone who is either:**  

  



* **An** **official Databricks Champion** **, recognized for their technical excellence and community contributions, or**
* **A** **high-level Databricks expert** **with the ambition and potential to become a Champion. With Capgemini’s support, network, and close partnership with Databricks, we’ll help you take that next step.**

  

**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**

* **We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work**
* **hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.**
* **At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.**
* **We partner with names such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Databricks, which can equip you with valuable certifications in the latest technologies, if that is your ambition.**
**About Capgemini**  

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.**  

  

**Get The Future You Want** **| www.capgemini.com**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: JavaScript Engineering Manager
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Lead the brightest brains to make a brighter world**

 **If you’re a passionate, progressive JavaScript expert, come and lead some of the brightest people as they search for solutions to enable a smarter, safer and more sustainable transport and infrastructure industry.**

  

As **JavaScript Engineering Manager** (named “**JavaScript Chapter Lead**” in our organization) you are **a technically skilled domain expert with the additional responsibility as line manager**. You will contribute to common ways of working across the Software Engineering Chapter through methods and best practices according to standards, technologies and trends. Your core responsibilities will involve both technical leadership – contributing to and guiding the team's technical work – and the management and development of a team of **JavaScript** engineers at your location.

  



We are experiencing the greatest shift in the history of transport and infrastructure. Tomorrow’s vehicles and construction equipment are electric, connected and autonomous, increasing safety and reducing environmental impact. With more than 1 million connected vehicles, Volvo Group is at the forefront of this evolution. Our ambition for 2030 is to be 100% safe, fossil-free and more productive, and to have 50% of revenue coming from areas other than our physical products. The shift is here, are you in?

 **Drive our digital transformation**

  

We are on an exciting journey within Volvo Group Digital & IT. Digital Delivery is a function within the Volvo Group Digital & IT that aims to identify and execute new digital initiatives and modernize existing solutions across the Volvo Group brands. With a new product-centric operating model and modern technology architecture we create digital products that are profitable, scalable and differentiated. We use a cross-functional approach to work on product design and deliveries that improve business performance and create value for the entire Volvo Group.

 **Here you will lead a team of software engineers who learn continuously and embrace change to stay ahead.**

 **What you will do**

  

As **JavaScript Engineering Manager** (**JavaScript** **Chapter Lead**) you are a **technically skilled domain expert with the additional responsibility as line manage**r.

 **Key responsibilities:**

* As Technical lead in delivery or product teams in **JavaScript**, responsible for hands-on coding, conducting thorough code reviews, and driving initiatives to ensure high software quality and technical standards
* Lead, develop and attract a team of talented **JavaScript** engineers, supporting their personal growth and challenges on assignments
* Develop and execute the competence strategy for **JavaScript** engineers within your team, meeting with chapter members to discuss and drive excellence in areas such as best practices, frameworks and tools
* Manage capacity planning, ensuring short and long-term competence and capacity of the **JavaScript** software engineers
* Work with stakeholders across the Volvo Group to be in line with changing business needs
* Secure external input and best practice sharing in the community
* Secure agile ways of working
* Balance your time between line manager and delivery team member

  

You will be part of the Software Engineering Leadership Team and report to one of the Chapter Area Leads.

 **Who are you?**

 **You are a passionate, professional and progressive leader with eyes on the horizon and feet on the ground.** As a Team Leader you should enjoy building and motivating high-performing teams and actively participate in strategy and execution. You should act as a role model for leaders and individual engineers as we develop **JavaScript** domain and community  

& **You need to have several years of experience as a practitioner (SW Engineer) and be a technical expert in the JavaScript** **domain.** Demonstrated leadership qualities to coach people or a few years´ experience of leading people, preferably in the **JavaScript** Domain is also crucial. Working with agile methodologies comes naturally to you.

 **Your mission**

* Be a People manager, managing a team of software engineers
* Be a Technical expert (Full Stack developer Node.js + React.js)
* Be a driver for planning, developing and implementing user interface and product solutions
* Work with designers and software engineers to develop modern & intuitive applications
* Be a mentor/ coach for other developers and line members

 **Must-Have Skills**

* Minimum 10 years of total IT experience
* At least 2 years of people management experience
* Minimum 5 years of recent practical experience in Node.js microservice development, building APIs and scripts in Node.js environment
* Practical experience and knowledge of React.js
* Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
* Well versed with technical standards and practices to ensure high software quality
* Enable development of high-performance applications by writing testable, reusable and efficient code
* Secure implementation of effective security protocols, data protection measures & storage solutions
* Knowledge of Progressive Web App principles
* Working experience in HTML5, CSS3 and responsive web design, Browser testing, troubleshooting and debugging
* Working knowledge of Azure Cloud Environment Platform
* Hands-on experience in code repository / CI&CD including GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps Pipelines, GitLab and others
* In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development & deployment)
* Focus on continuous code improvements to optimize performance

**Other skills**

* Experience with compensation and talent management
* Have done coaching or mentorship
* Self-motivated and motivates others
* Works well independently and as part of the team
* Experience in SCRUM methodology
* Excellent communication skills and resilience
* Customer oriented and proactive problem solver

**Location:**
-------------


We are looking for someone to join our local office in Sweden, **Gothenburg.**

**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------

  

Are you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can’t wait to hear from you. Apply today!

  

Last application date is: 8th June 2025

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

description:
**Position Description:**
-------------------------


Vi sker en erfaren utvecklare som vill ta steget till Tech Lead och som vill vara med och forma framtiden fr vra kunders samhllsviktiga system. Som Tech Lead hos CGI kommer du f leda ditt utvecklingsteam, antingen genom att leda ett av vra befintliga team eller vara med och stta ihop ett nytt team.  

  

r du redo fr nsta steg i karriren? Vlkommen med din anskan!


**Your future duties and responsibilities:**
--------------------------------------------


Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i ett agilt team dr eget initiativ, ansvarstagande och flexibilitet r centrala. Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila miljer och en vilja att leda team genom hela utvecklingskedjan, frn krav till test och underhll.

Pensionslsningar som r attraktiva och frmnliga

r du redo fr nsta steg i karriren? Vlkommen med din anskan!

title: Kravanalytiker
description:
Kravanalytiker med teknisk testkompetens – agilt leveransteam
  
Vi söker en strukturerad och lösningsorienterad kravanalytiker med teknisk förståelse och erfarenhet av systemtestning för ett långsiktigt utvecklingsuppdrag i en agil miljö. I denna roll får du en central funktion i ett utvecklingsteam med stort ansvar, där du bidrar i hela kedjan från kravanalys till test och leverans.
  
Uppdraget är en del av ett strategiskt initiativ för att vidareutveckla och förvalta digitala lösningar som stödjer organisationens långsiktiga mål. Teamet arbetar enligt moderna, iterativa arbetssätt där kvalitet, tillgänglighet och säkerhet står i fokus.
  
  

Ansvarsområden
  
  

**Som kravanalytiker i ett agilt team kommer du att:**  

Arbeta nära verksamheten för att samla in och omsätta behov till strukturerade och testbara krav
  
Använda metoder som acceptanskriterier och scenario-baserad nedbrytning för att skapa inkrementellt värde
  
Formulera tydliga kravbilder kring integrationer med externa aktörer, särskilt med fokus på hög IT-säkerhet
  
Delta i utvecklingen av användargränssnitt för både interna och externa användare
  
Säkerställa spårbarhet från krav till verifiering/test
  
  

Testansvar
  
Du kommer även att ha en viktig roll i teamets testarbete, med ansvar för att:
  
Planera och genomföra tekniska tester såsom system- och integrationstest
  
Arbeta med testautomatisering samt testdriven och beteendedriven utveckling (TDD/BDD)
  
Utföra tillgänglighetstester enligt WCAG
  
Hantera SQL-frågor för att verifiera datakvalitet och logik
  
Säkerställa testbarhet och tydlig dokumentation av systemkrav
  
  

Arbetssätt och miljö
  
Agil leveransmodell med stort teamansvar
  
Iterativt arbetssätt inspirerat av SAFe
  
Fokus på kontinuerlig integration och leverans (CI/CD)
  
Tätt samarbete med utvecklare, produktägare och andra roller i teamet
  
Betoning på förbättringsarbete, automation och kvalitetssäkring
  
  

Använda verktyg och tekniker
  
**Krav & test:** Jira, Xray, Confluence, Balsamiq
  
**Testautomation & API:** Cypress, Cucumber, Gherkin, Insomnia
  
**Versionshantering & DevOps:** GitLab
  
**Databas:** SQL
  
  

Din profil
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Har erfarenhet som kravanalytiker och testare i agila utvecklingsmiljöer
  
Är van att arbeta med tekniska krav och integrationer
  
Har god kunskap om tillgänglighetskrav och säkerhetsaspekter i IT-lösningar
  
Har erfarenhet av testautomatisering och gärna testdriven utveckling
  
Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska i tal och skrift
  
Är noggrann, analytisk och samarbetsorienterad
  
  

Om uppdraget
  
**Start:** Oktober 2025
  
**Slut:** September 2027, med möjlighet till förlängning till 2028
  
**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
**Placering:** Sundsvall, arbete sker på plats
  
  

Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Azure Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
Vi ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara "beside you", "behind you" och "before you". Vi kallar det för "The Iver way". Nu söker vi enAzure Cloud Platform Engineersom vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder!Är du vår nya kollega?
  
  

**Om Iver:**  

Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 500 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 25 kontor i Norden.
  
  

Din roll på Iver?
  
Vi höjer ribban för vad moderna och innovativa molnplattformstjänster innebär. Det är en spännande transformation, och vi behöver fler resurser för att leverera detta – så om du är en framåtblickande Azure-Engineer som andas cloud-native, infrastruktur-som-kod och AI-driven automatisering, är detta din chans att arbeta med de allra bästa inom branschen.
  
Cloud Platform Engineer är en nyckelroll inom Cloud Platform teamet och fokuserar på design, implementation och underhåll av molninfrastruktur och tjänster på Azure. Denna roll ansvarar för att säkerställa tillförlitlighet, skalbarhet och säkerhet för molnbaserade lösningar, inklusive komponenter för beräkning, lagring, nätverk och säkerhet. Du kommer att arbeta inom Ivers Azure Engineering Team för att utveckla våra managerade plattformstjänster för Azure och stödja kunders onboarding. Du kommer även att hantera incidenter relaterade till Azure-resurser på en nivå 3-kapacitet, utföra grundorsaksanalys och implementera åtgärder för att förhindra upprepning.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**  

Designa, distribuera och hantera skalbar infrastruktur i Azure med Infrastructure as Code (IaC)-verktyg som Terraform, Bicep och ARM.
  
Automatisera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines för effektiv mjukvaruleverans med verktyg som GitHub Actions och Azure DevOps.
  
Implementera och hantera containerisering med Docker och orkestrering med Kubernetes eller AKS.
  
Övervaka, felsök och optimera molnmiljöer för prestanda, skalbarhet och kostnadseffektivitet.
  
Arbeta nära säkerhetsteam för att säkerställa bästa praxis inom molnsäkerhet, inklusive IAM, kryptering och regelefterlevnad.
  
Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att implementera DevOps-principer och säkerställa att infrastrukturen är anpassad till applikationens behov.
  
Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste molnteknikerna och trenderna samt kontinuerligt förbättra vår infrastruktursetup.
  
  

Vad erbjuder vi dig?
  
Iver - We empower our Nordic society. På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
  
  

Vem söker vi?
  
Vi söker dig som är en driven Azure-entusiast som är intresserad av att jobba som rådgivande specialistkonsult. Vårt uppdrag är att tillhandahålla expertrådgivning och lösningar för våra kunder i deras tekniska resa. Vi förväntar oss att du med stor nyfikenhet leder dig själv och kunden till nya kreativa lösningar och metoder, och du har en stort intresse för den ständigt pågående cloudtekniska utvecklingen. För att lyckas i rollen hos oss tror vi att du är en god kommunikatör med förmåga att göra komplex IT enkel, du förstår vikten av att arbeta tillsammans för att nå mål och du har god affärsförståelse.
  
  

**Vidare tror vi att du har:**  

3-5+ års erfarenhet eller motsvarande av implementation och distribution inom Microsoft Azure-plattformen
  
Djup kunskap om Microsofts Cloudlösningar som IaaS, PaaS och Serverless
  
Erfarenhet av automatiseringsverktyg som ARM-mallar, Terraform, Chef eller Ansible
  
Erfarenhet av Docker och Kubernetes
  
Utveckling eller scripting erfarenhet i C# eller PowerShell
  
Kunskap och erfarenhet inom nätverkstopologier och brandväggar
  
Kunskap och erfarenhet inom praxis för säkerhet inom lösningar för infrastruktur, applikationer, IAM eller olika plattformar
  
Mycket god kunskap inom Microsoft-verktyg och plattformar t ex som Azure, Office 365, Power BI, Active Directory, Intune etc.
  
För den här rollen krävs flytande i såväl svenska som engelska.
  
  

**Placeringsort:**  

Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm, Malmö, Göteborg eller Oslo.
  
  

Sök till oss!
  
Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.Du är välkommen att kontakta Olav Nguyen (olav.nguyen@iver.no) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
Välkommen till Iver!

title: Applikationstekniker
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett företag som arbetar för att skydda både människor och samhällen? Vår kund arbetar i en spännande och varierad miljö där de tillsammans verkar för att skapa de produkter och tjänster som behövs för att uppfylla detta.
  
  

Din framtida utmaning
  
Vi letar efter dig som är en erfaren applikationstekniker. Du kommer att bli en del av ett team som jobbar med förvaltning av ett antal olika applikationer, mestadels on-prem. Du kommer i huvudsak arbeta med drift- och förvaltning, men det kan även bli aktuellt att vara med i projekt vid införande av nya system.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter är:**  

* Säkerställa att den dagliga driften fungerar, t ex via monitorering av loggar.
* Ärendehantering: lösa incidenter samt arbeta med change (ändringar och önskemål).
* Installation och uppgradering av applikationer
* Dokumentation (goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift).
* Införande av ständiga förbättringar, automatiseringar mm.


Den du är idag
  
Vi letar efter en noggrann och metodisk problemlösare. Du är van vid att ta ansvar för ditt eget arbete. Vi förväntar oss att du ska ha goda analytiska färdigheter, noggrannhet med detaljer samt en förmåga att strukturera och dokumentera ditt arbete.
  
För att trivas i rollen behöver du ha en god förståelse för hur applikationer fungerar generellt och bör ha kunskap i att ta fram script för t ex automatisering av övervakning.
  
erfarenhet av applikationsdrift
  
ha jobbat med Windows Server och Microsoft SQL,
  
samt erfarenhet av förvaltning av webbapplikationer med Microsoft IIS som plattform.
  
Goda färdigheter i svenska och engelska, både i tal och i skrift.
  
Svensk medborgare
  
  

Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av
  
att arbeta som systemutvecklare och förståelse för konto- och behörighetshantering (Active Directory).
  
Mobilappar
  
ITIL som ramverk
  
Agila arbetssätt, ex scrum eller DevOps
  
Testning, Funktionstestning
  
ServiceNow
  
Jira
  
Rollen kräver även god förmåga att samarbeta med kollegor inom IT-organisationen, verksamheten och leverantörer. Vi anser att kommunikation är en viktig del i att lyckas med våra åtaganden och därför sätter vi stort värde på din sociala kompetens och ”teamwork”.
  
  

Omfattning och villkor
  
Behovet av denna resurs är omgående och tolv månader framåt på heltid, med möjlighet till förlängning. Resor inom Sverige blir aktuellt någon gång per månad.
  
Visstidsanställning med möjlighet till förlängning. Vi tillämpar kollektivavtal.
  
Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd.
  
  

Visst låter detta som ett intressant uppdrag?
  
Sök redan i dag eller kontakta oss så berättar vi gärna mer. Vi behöver en ansökan inkluderat CV på svenska som matchar vår kunds krav. Kunden kan fatta beslut tidigare än sista ansökningsdatum, urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
  
  

NXT Interim och NXT Rekrytering är ett nischat och innovativt företag som är verksamma inom konsult och rekryteringsbranschen. Vi är verksamma inom HR, IT, Ekonomi, Sälj och Marknad och har över 20 års erfarenhet i branschen. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter bl.a sjukförsäkring, remote-arbetsplatser och flera andra förmåner som förgyller deras vardag. Vid anställning tillämpar vi kollektivavtal.

title: Technical Test Engineer
description:
### **Software Tester – Manual & Automated QA for Advanced Systems**


We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented **Software Tester** to join a forward-thinking development environment focused on delivering reliable, high-quality software. This role plays a vital part in ensuring that both new and existing solutions meet the highest standards of performance, functionality, and stability.


As a tester in this team, you will be deeply involved in all phases of the testing lifecycle — from interpreting system specifications and requirements to designing and executing test cases, analyzing results, and providing valuable feedback to cross-functional teams. You will take an active role in driving quality improvements through both manual and automated testing strategies in a high-paced and collaborative setting.

### **Responsibilities**

* Design, execute, and maintain both manual and automated test cases based on system requirements and functional specifications
* Perform end-to-end validation of system functionality, including integration, regression, performance, and post-deployment testing
* Use tools such as **Jira XRAY**, **JMeter**, and **SOAP UI** to document and manage test activities and outcomes
* Report, track, and analyze software issues and deviations, working closely with development and engineering teams to ensure timely resolution
* Contribute to the development and maintenance of automation frameworks and CI/CD testing pipelines
* Validate APIs and network protocols, ensuring system compatibility and performance under various conditions
* Participate in agile ceremonies and collaborate with developers, analysts, and stakeholders throughout the product lifecycle
* Produce clear documentation for test procedures, outcomes, and issue logs, supporting knowledge sharing and compliance
* Evaluate software usability from a user perspective and provide insights to improve experience and functionality

### **Qualifications**

* Strong experience in software testing, with a balanced mix of **manual and automated QA**
* Familiarity with tools such as **Jira**, **XRAY**, **JMeter**, **SOAP UI**, and **Jenkins**
* Solid understanding of testing principles across the SDLC and agile/DevOps environments
* Experience with **API validation, scripting**, and **network-level testing** is highly desirable
* Practical knowledge of **telecom systems**, protocols, or embedded platforms is considered a significant advantage
* Comfortable working in fast-changing, iterative development environments with continuous integration and deployment
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, with an eye for detail and a commitment to high-quality delivery
* Ability to work autonomously and proactively while also thriving in collaborative team settings
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate issues, results, and improvement suggestions

### **Desirable Attributes**

* Hands-on experience with test automation scripting or frameworks
* Understanding of network stack protocols and systems performance monitoring
* A proactive, structured, and quality-driven mindset with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* A passion for problem-solving, continuous learning, and adapting to new technologies

 **About** **Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Group Lead och Azure specialist
description:
- **Vill du vara med på resan när vi startar upp Creative tech enheten i Göteborg? Vill du arbeta tillsammans med inspirerande, glada och kompetenta kollegor i ett av Göteborgs mest innovativa och centrala nav kring mjukvaruutveckling? Söker du en roll där du kan kombinera din expertis som konsult med ledarskap och strategiskt ansvar och vara med och skapa innovativa digitala produkter?**

**Vilka är vi?**  

Vi är ett IT-konsultföretag som främjar en kultur där medarbetarna känner sig trygga, inspirerade och glada. Vi tror att detta är den bästa miljön där människor kan växa och bygga de bästa produkterna. Vi grundades år 2000, vi har en långsiktig syn på våra kunder och medarbetarrelationer och hoppas att du kommer att vilja stanna hos oss länge.


Visste du att vi faktiskt också grundade utvecklarkonferensen Øredev som fortfarande är en del av samma företag?

  
**Vem är du?**

Vi söker en Group Lead till vår Azure utvecklingsenhet i Göteborg. Denna roll är perfekt om du vill kombinera konsultrollen med ledarskaps- och ledningsansvar.


Som Group Lead kommer du i första hand arbeta med konsultuppdrag inriktade på Azure arkitektur och utveckling. Vi söker en senior utvecklare/arkitekt med bred erfarenhet av mjukvarulösningar inom Azure och med en förmåga att se helheten. Du har lång erfarenhet av utveckling samt av att sätta upp och granska Azure-miljöer. Även om vi söker en ledare vill vi ändå att du fortfarande har en vilja och ett driv att skriva, granska och felsöka kod. Vi ser dig vidare som aktiv i vårt partnersamarbete, där du gillar att utforska nya erbjudanden från Azure och hjälpa Devoteam Creative Tech ligga i framkant inom moln-innovation.


I rollen har du också ett personalansvar för 6-10 konsulter inom Azure-enheten. Där det primära målet är att jobba med ditt team och coacha dina medarbetare och främja en kultur av kontinuerligt lärande.


Rollen omfattar även affärsutveckling där du fungerar som en brygga mellan säljteam, kunder och leveransteam. Genom nära samarbete kommer du att bidra till att utveckla vårt erbjudande och bygga starka kundrelationer inom Azure-området.


Att balansera konsultuppdrag, personalansvar och affärsutveckling kräver ett starkt självledarskap, vilket är avgörande för att lyckas i denna roll.


Certifieringar inom Azure är viktiga och meriterande men inget krav.


  
**Vi söker dig som**

* Har minst 6 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruarkitektur och utveckling.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av en ledarroll med personalansvar är meriterande.
* Trygg i att föra diskussioner med kunder både på svenska och engelska.
* Skicklig med att omsätta verksamhetskrav till design av säkra, skalbara samt kostnadseffektiva lösningar.
* Stark vilja att leverera utmärkt service, med fokus på kundernas behov och framgång.
* Har en genuin förståelse för det agila arbetssättet och en vilja och ett fokus att snabbt leverera värde.
* God förståelse för DevOps principer och förmåga att integrera dem i arkitekturella beslut.

  
- **Vad får du?**  

Vi erbjuder dig individuell och betald kompetensutveckling på arbetstid, flexibelt arbete och ett generöst förmånspaket. Du kommer att ingå i vårt team av ledare och kan påverka allt från vilket uppdrag som känns rätt för dig, forma våra erbjudanden och partnerskap, samt bidra till framtiden för Devoteam Creative Tech i Sverige.


**Varför tveka?**  

Skicka in din ansökan till oss så kontaktar vi dig så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


**En rättvis chans!**  

Devoteam är öppet för ansökningar från alla delar av samhället. Vi tror att olikheter inom team hjälper oss att skapa bättre produkter. Vi välkomnar alla människor oavsett ålder, könsidentitet eller uttryck, erfarenhet och bakgrund. Om du kan se dig själv i denna roll och känner att denna tjänst kan tillföra värde både för dig och för Devoteam, uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in din ansökan till oss - även om du inte nödvändigtvis uppfyller alla ovanstående krav.

title: Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer** 
 to our Information Systems (IS) team. This role is an opportunity for an "automation-first" technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have experience of IT operations automation, Infrastructure as Code and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The IS team at Canonical supports and maintains all of Canonical's IT production services. The team is in charge of running services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.
   

  

 As an SRE & Gitops engineer you'll be in a unique position to drive operations automation to the next level, both in our own private clouds as well as in the public clouds. We do this by utilizing the best of open source infrastructure as code software, software development practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and Canonical's leading products for software operation automation.
   

  

 In addition to defining the infrastructure as code, you will improve Canonical products and the open-source technologies they're based on by providing critical feedback to developers on how their products operate at scale. This is done by submitting bugs (and sometimes writing pull requests) and collaborating on design and implementations with other teams within the company.
   

  

 You'll be part of a global team of SREs that work together and support each other to provide the best possible services to our company, Canonical's customers and the Ubuntu Community.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role is available remotely in any timezone.
   

  

 As a Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer engineer you will
   

  

* Apply your experience of IaC to develop infrastructure as code practice within IS by constantly increasing automation and improving IaC processes
* Automate software operations for re-usability and consistency across private and public clouds, taking into consideration the complexities of distributed systems
* Develop new features and improve the resilience and scalability of the existing cloud and container portfolio at Canonical
* Maintain operational responsibility for all of Canonical's core services, networks, and infrastructure
* Develop skills in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance investigation, Setting up, maintaining and using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and Elasticsearch; design, implement and maintain monitoring and alerting for various systems and services
* Collaborate with development teams to design service architecture, documentation, playbooks, policies and operational procedures
* Provide assistance and work with globally distributed engineering, operations, and support peers
* Be given uninterrupted development time to focus on larger projects and automation of manual tasks
* Share your experience, know-how and best practices with other team members in design sessions, mentorship and 'doing work together'
* Carry final responsibility for time-critical escalations


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* A deep experience of, and knowledge to define operations in code, using version control, peer review and CI/CD to roll out changes both to applications and infrastructure
* Strong modern engineering background (peer-review, unit testing, SCM, CI/CD, Agile)
* Python software development experience, with large projects
* Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls
* Affinity with various forms of Linux storage, from Ceph to Databases
* Hands-on experience administering enterprise Linux servers
* Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies
* Bachelor's degree or greater, preferably in computer science or related engineering field
* Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English over email, chat, video or voice calls and in-person
* Motivated and able to troubleshoot from kernel to web, and willing to ask others when appropriate
* A willingness to be flexible and able to learn new things quickly
* Be inspired by the needs of fast-changing environments
* Happy to work within distributed teams
* Be passionate and familiarized about open-source, especially Ubuntu or Debian


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:

 . As a pioneer in the GambleFi space, we empower operators to launch high-performance casino sites with transparent, on-chain infrastructure, rapid deployment, and innovative player incentives. Our decentralized bankroll, inspired by Decentralized Finance (DeFi) principles, allows anyone to participate in the casino economy by providing liquidity on-chain.
 




  






 We’re currently in a strong expansion phase, scaling our product, teams, and impact. To support this growth, we’re looking for a

 🔧
 

**What You’ll Do** 



* Hire and retain top-tier engineering talent to scale our development teams with superstar performers.
* Manage and scale our three core engineering teams: Platform, Casino White Label, and Back Office.
* Own the delivery of scalable backend services and robust casino platform features.
* Implement agile workflows that optimize speed, quality, and team autonomy.
* Collaborate with Product, Design, and Leadership to drive product vision and execution.

 🌍
 
**Location** 




 This is a hybrid position based in Stockholm, Sweden.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
About Us
 
 Join us at 
 
 CDON Group
 
 , a Swedish listed company with a long history and extensive experience in the e-commerce market. Our mission is to unleash the power of the marketplace to give the best shopping experience in the Nordics. We're dedicated to providing great online shopping experiences and are on the lookout for a 
 
 Backend Engineer
 
  to join us on this journey for our two Nordic marketplaces: 
 
 CDON
 
  and 
 
 Fyndiq
 
 .
 



  




 About the Role
 
 Ready to build, optimize, and innovate on a platform that's central to one of the Nordics' leading marketplaces? At CDON, we've just completed a massive overhaul, modernizing our entire tech ecosystem, with AI at its core.
 



 As a 
 
 Backend Engineer
 
 , you'll be joining a small, highly skilled, AI powered and collaborative team where your contributions will have a direct and measurable impact. We're talking about the core of our business – without our robust platform, there's no marketplace.
 



  




 Responsibilities
 * Design, develop, and deploy robust and scalable backend services using 
 
 Python 3.x
 
  and 
 
 FastAPI
 
 .
* Build and maintain critical components of our marketplace platform that directly power the CDON marketplace, and create
 
  AI powered 
 
 features.
* Work with distributed systems technologies like 
 
 Kafka
 
  and 
 
 Kubernetes
 
  to ensure high availability and performance.
* Manage and optimize data persistence layers using a variety of databases, including 
 
 PostgreSQL, OpenSearch, MongoDB, and Redis
 
 .
* Collaborate closely with a small, specialized, and skilled team to solve complex business problems and implement innovative solutions.
* Contribute to the entire software development lifecycle, from architectural discussions and design to coding, testing, and deployment.
* Ensure the reliability, security, and efficiency of our platform as we continue to modernize and scale.
* Participate in code reviews, share knowledge, and contribute to a collaborative team environment.



  




 Qualifications and Requirements
 * Experience
 
  
 
 with 
 
 event driven systems 
 
 and 
 
 microservices
* A proven track record in building and operating complex systems.
* Solid development skills in 
 
 Python
 
 , OR knowledge of several other languages and a willingness to learn Python.
* A proactive and problem-solving mindset.
* A 
 
 DevOps culture mindset
 
 .
* Experience with 
 
 cloud environments (GCP, AWS, etc.)
 
 .



  




 What We Offer
 * An opportunity to be part of a unique growth journey, actively contributing to the success of the leading e-commerce marketplaces in the Nordics.
* A collaborative and dynamic work environment, with passionate colleagues who believe in CDON Group’s mission.
* Competitive compensation package, including benefits such as pension and insurance through Max 
 
 Matthiessen
 
  and 
 
 MyBenefit
 
  portal.
* Career growth opportunities within a rapidly evolving company.



  




 Application Process
 
 Link to Application
 



 https://careers.cdon.com/jobs/5169476-backend-engineer-cdon-drive-the-future-of-e-commerce/287a864d-9a7c-4e2a-926f-d1922bf40f88
 



  





 Please attach your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your interest and suitability for the job. We will be conducting interviews with candidates on an ongoing basis.
 



  





 To ensure a professional and unbiased assessment, we will ask candidates to perform a combination of logical reasoning and personality tests as part of the process.

title: Head of Engineering Team (Full-time, permanent)
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
 Pontus, our Director of Engineering, is looking to strengthen the team with an experienced leader. You will take on the very honorary task of leading two international teams from our Stockholm office.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* You will lead two skilled and dedicated international teams, working closely with both products and customers. The solutions the teams build have a profound impact on millions of users each day.
* Stay relevant regarding security topics by joining an innovative identity and security company that secures society by enabling "Zero Trust" identities for people and things, in both the physical and digital world.
* Take the lead in driving transformative change within your teams and on a global scale, contributing to continuous improvement and innovation.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 As a Head of Engineering team, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring that our roadmap and departmental goals are met. You will steer your teams in the right direction, aligning with our overall strategic mission and long-term goals. Your leadership will be crucial in fostering a productive and innovative environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To**
* Be an exceptional leader for two outstanding teams. This includes long-term planning as well as day-to-day activities such as stand-ups, supporting the teams, and ensuring they have the right foundation to complete their tasks.
* Handle all people management tasks, including continuous dialogue with team members through 1-on-1s and performance reviews.
* Ensure the alignment of all ways of working, including processes, tools, and methodologies.
* Work closely with various internal and external partners to optimize processes and ensure effective communication between departments.
* Drive incidents and improvements within your teams, ensuring swift resolution and continuous enhancement.


**Some of our Tech Stack:** 
 Java, Spring Boot, Angular, REST, GIT, Docker, Kubernetes, SonarQube, Microservice, Azure DevOps, Open ID Connect, SAML
   

  

**Some of our Tools:** 
 Jira, Confluence, Sympa, Team Tailor
   

  

**About You**
* You are decisive, making informed decisions quickly and confidently.
* You can develop and implement strategic plans that align with organizational goals, driving innovation and efficiency.
* You are adaptable to changing technologies and methodologies, continuously seeking improvement and staying ahead of industry trends.
* You promote a collaborative environment, encouraging teamwork and cross-functional cooperation.
* You possess high emotional intelligence, effectively managing interpersonal relationships and understanding team dynamics.


**Qualifications**
* You bring several years of experience as an Engineering Manager in the software industry, demonstrating your ability to lead and inspire teams.
* You possess relevant management experience with full people responsibility, showcasing your capability to drive team success and accountability.
* You thrive in this role by having a genuine passion for coaching teams and individuals, fostering growth and development.
* You have a good understanding of our tech stack, enabling you to guide technical decisions and support your teams effectively.
* You have a working proficiency level in English, ensuring clear and effective communication within the teams and with stakeholders.


**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**CV Requirement**
 Please upload your CV in English.
   

  

**Background check**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.
   

  

**Joining Nexus** 
 means becoming a part of IN Groupe, an international group of around 2000 employees on five continents.
   

  

 IN Groupe and Nexus are here to protect the identities of people and things making life both safer and simpler.
   

  

 The group meets the needs of states, businesses, and hundreds of millions of users in Europe and throughout the world.
   

  

 We provide the best of technology and innovation, in a sustainable manner, now and for future generations.
   

  

 At Nexus we believe transparency is a prerequisite for trust and therefore all our
 **products and services are documented online.**

title: Platform Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
We are the newly established Data Platform Services team within Telia Technology Analytics Platforms unit. Our mission is to deliver top-tier, purpose-built, and value-driven capabilities in Data and AI to Telia. We believe that enhancing analytical capabilities is crucial for boosting Telia’s operational efficiency, improving our product offerings, and elevating customer experience. To accomplish this, we provide a unified set of tools designed to meet the needs of every country.
   

  

 My name is Mikko Olin, Head of Data Platform Services, and I am seeking team members who are enthusiastic about collaborating closely with our on-premises open-source data Lakehouse, Arcus, in Sweden. Arcus is our next-generation analytics platform, enabling in-country analytics with Lakehouse capabilities. It is built entirely on open-source technology with dedicated hardware and extensive GPU computing power. Our latest iteration supports near real-time use cases, ML Ops, relational databases (Postgres), and GenAI.
   

  

**Is this you?**
 You excel at analyzing complex problems, articulating suggested solutions, developing them, and collaborating with colleagues when needed. You take ownership of your responsibilities and are an excellent communicator.
   

  

 Your personality:
   

  

* Team player
* Self-motivated with learning mindset
* Understand business value and demonstrate it in implemented solutions
* Good storytelling skills


 We would like you to have experience from some of the below:
   

  

* Python
* Managing Kubernetes deployments and infrastructure
* Experience with Apache Spark, Apache Airflow and Trino
* IAC using Helm and Ansible
* Setting up CI/CD pipelines
* GitHub & GitHub Actions


 Bonus if you also have experience from:
   

  

* Setting up data analytics platforms using cloud native components in Kubernetes
* Nvidia AI stack
* DBT (data build tool)
* Data warehouse & analytics background


**We are more than a workplace**
 Join Telia and our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job, reach out to Mikko Olin, mikko.olin@teliacompany.com
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. Application deadline is
 **2025-06-04**
**Join us and let's make better happen - together!**

title: Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 We're currently transforming our AWS infrastructure by moving from our custom container platform to ECS/Fargate. In this role, you'll help evolve our sophisticated infrastructure-as-code foundation that provisions AWS services with different networking patterns, DNS configurations, and security boundaries. Also, you will participating in architecture discussions to determine optimal service patterns.
   

  

 We are hosted in AWS and 100% cloud-native. If you, like us, are a tech-savvy person - you’ll fit right in!
   

  

**Among Other Things, You’ll Be Doing**
* Leading the migration from our custom orchestration to AWS ECS/Fargate
* Designing and implementing networking solutions
* Collaborating with development teams to implement service discovery patterns
* Configuring load balancers for different traffic flows and security boundaries
* Sharing knowledge with team members through pairing sessions and documentation
* Adapting to changing requirements as we evolve our platform architecture
* Helping solve complex production issues alongside your teammates


**What We’re Looking For**
 We believe you are currently working as a Senior Infrastructure Engineer, Senior DevOps Engineer, Senior Platform Engineer or Senior Site Reliability Engineer with relevant experience. Our team values individuals who embrace learning over knowing everything, thrive in collaborative environments, and adapt quickly to changing requirements. This role requires strong technical curiosity and a collaborative mindset as we navigate the complexities of cloud modernization.
   

  

**Successful Candidates Also Meet The Following Requirements**
* Solid problem-solving skills and experience in architecting solutions in AWS
* Programming experience in Node.js
* Strong interest in continuous integration and continuous deployment, automation and other efficient workflow-oriented practices.
* Experience with AWS networking, load balancing, and container orchestration
* Understanding of DNS management and service discovery patterns
* Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code principles.
* Knowledge of Python programming


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Senior Engineer
description:
Team delivers functionality to a varsity of tools used by the real estate market around the world.
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and implement new features and enhancements that meet business requirements and align with the technical architecture
* Develop and support scalable, applications and systems and serve features for the property- and index market on our web and API products
* Closely collaborate with partners across product and design, engineering, and business teams to drive innovations that improve our customers’ experience
* Follow software-development best practices including test-driven development, contributing to documentation, feature flagging, etc
* Help to maintain and improve existing pipelines
* Collaborate with DevOps to plan resources and continuously optimize the infrastructure and configuration of our data pipelines to ensure a healthy and high-performance production deployments
* Performing any other tasks as assigned by line manager
* Performing any other tasks as assigned by line manager
* Bachelors degree in Computer Science, or a related field
* 5+ years of relevant back-end programming experience using languages such as .Net, Python or Node.js
* Solid comprehension of common design patterns, algorithms, and data structures
* Solid understanding of distributed systems
* Working knowledge of containerization
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Experience with event-driven processing within a microservices oriented architecture
* Knowledge of Test Driven Development, Refactoring, Clean Code and Clean Architecture
* Experience working in an Agile software development organization


**What We Offer You**
* Transparent compensation schemes and comprehensive employee benefits, tailored to your location, ensuring your financial security, health, and overall wellbeing.
* Flexible working arrangements, advanced technology, and collaborative workspaces.
* A culture of high performance and innovation where we experiment with new ideas and take responsibility for achieving results.
* A global network of talented colleagues, who inspire, support, and share their expertise to innovate and deliver for our clients.
* Global Orientation program to kickstart your journey, followed by access to our Learning@MSCI platform, LinkedIn Learning Pro and tailored learning opportunities for ongoing skills development.
* Multi-directional career paths that offer professional growth and development through new challenges, internal mobility and expanded roles.
* We actively nurture an environment that builds a sense of inclusion belonging and connection, including eight Employee Resource Groups. All Abilities, Asian Support Network, Black Leadership Network, Climate Action Network, Hola! MSCI, Pride & Allies, Women in Tech, and Women’s Leadership Forum.


 At MSCI we are passionate about what we do, and we are inspired by our purpose - to power better investment decisions. You’ll be part of an industry-leading network of creative, curious, and entrepreneurial pioneers. This is a space where you can challenge yourself, set new standards and perform beyond expectations for yourself, our clients, and our industry.
   

  

 MSCI is a leading provider of critical decision support tools and services for the global investment community. With over 50 years of expertise in research, data, and technology, we power better investment decisions by enabling clients to understand and analyze key drivers of risk and return and confidently build more effective portfolios.  MSCI Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. title: Data Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
* Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
* Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
* Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
* Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams


 Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies
   

  

**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* At least 4+ year’s work experience including hands-on as Data engineer on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Experience in GCP tools – Dataflow, Dataproc and Bigquery
* Experience in Data Build Tool (DBT)
* Experience in different data formats (Avro, Parquet)
* Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
* Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
* Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
* Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
* Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
* Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
* Experience in working with data visualization tools
* Fluent in English both written and verbal


**Meritorious**
* Experience in data processing framework – Beam, Spark, Hive, Flink
* Business understanding of retail industry


**Application deadline:** 
 03-08-2025
   

  

**About Us**

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
