title: Cloudspecialist
description:
Är du en driven och lösningsorienterad tekniker med expertis inom Microsoft Azure? Söker du en ny utmaning där du kan bidra med din tekniska kompetens? Låt Centric hjälpa dig med det! Vi söker personer till flera av våra kunder i Stockholm med minst fem års yrkeserfarenhet inom cloud som trivs med att utveckla en organisations IT-miljö i olika konsultuppdrag.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Som Cloudspecialist kan din vardag se ut på olika sätt. Du kan exempelvis arbeta mot befintliga kunder eller nykund, eller så arbetar du med att stötta kunder genom att implementera, förvalta eller utforma molnlösningar, alternativt så har du ett helhetsansvar för en IT-infrastruktur med fokus på molntjänsterna Microsoft 365 och Azure. Är du inriktad mot AWS eller GCP är du givetvis också av intresse.
   

  

*I denna tjänst kan dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden bestå av att:*
* Designa, implementera och underhålla robusta molnarkitekturer i Microsoft Azure
* Leda migrationer till molnbaserade miljöer
* Ansvara för att dokumentera intern miljö
* Hantera och optimera Azure-miljön inklusive virtuella nätverk, lagringslösningar, databaser och molnresurser
* Upprätthålla bästa praxis för molnlösningar och säkerhet
* Utföra supportärenden som eskalerats till 3rd line
* Automatisera implementeringsprocesser med hjälp av verktyg som till exempel Azure DevOps


**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 För att du ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna från start ser vi gärna att du har minst fem års yrkeserfarenhet inom liknande arbetsuppgifter, är kundorienterad och trivs med att ge god service och support till användarna. Som person är du ansvarstagande och proaktiv. Du talar och skriver svenska samt engelska obehindrat.
   

  

*Det är ett krav att du har minst fem års erfarenhet av att arbeta med/i:*
* Azure
* Entra
* Intune
* Autopilot


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Enterprise Architect - People
description:
**Job Description**
 We at H&M Group, have a vision to liberate fashion for the many. Our Enterprise Architecture team helps align and enable business and tech, provide holistic architecture direction and governance, balancing the long-term and the short-term. Using robust frameworks and best practices they support an effective and efficient tech delivery.
   

  

 To strengthen our team, we are now hiring more Enterprise Architects to further level up our support to business and tech in several areas.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 Our architecture landscape is divided into segments, where the Colleague segment covers our Talent management, Workforce management, Collaboration, Knowledge management, Compensation, Travel & Expense, HR Operations, IT Operating model, Portfolio management & corporate capabilities.
   

  

 As an Enterprise Architect – People, you will play a key role in shaping the future of HR, Collaboration and workforce management technology in a fast-evolving enterprise environment. You will work cross-functionally to define, optimize, and evolve our Collboration and HR technology landscape while enabling seamless Employee experiences across all touchpoints.
   

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**
**Technology Strategy & Business Alignment:**
* Define and drive the HR business functional & technology architecture, ensuring alignment with business strategy to enhance workforce efficiency, talent management, and operational effectiveness.
* Lead the transition from current to future state architectures, ensuring seamless execution through structured stakeholder engagement.
* Identify cross-dependencies between business processes and technology, guiding capability development, process improvements, and digital transformation initiatives.


**Architectural Governance & Optimization:**
* Establish and maintain enterprise-wide architecture principles, frameworks, and roadmaps to standardize HR technologies.
* Evaluate and improve the HR tech landscape, reducing technical debt, optimizing integration, and enhancing end-to-end business value.
* Assess industry trends and emerging technologies (AI, automation, RPA) to determine their potential impact on HR systems and workforce management.


**Strategic Leadership & Decision Support:**
* Guide and coach stakeholders on investment decisions, balancing risks, costs, and business priorities.
* Support in defining and implementing new operating models and technology-driven HR initiatives.
* Collaborate with third-party vendors, ensuring strategic partnerships align with business objectives and technology roadmaps.
* Work closely with architects across Talent, Workforce, Compensation, Collaboration, HR Operations, and Travel & Expense segments to integrate People technology solutions.
* Oversee solution design, integration development, and roadmap execution, ensuring HR technology delivers tangible business outcomes.
* Participate in enterprise architecture practices, fostering best practices and knowledge sharing across teams.


**YOU’LL WORK WITH**
 As an Enterprise Architect, you will collaborate closely with business stakeholder & architects across different segments, ensuring seamless integration between People, Employee Experience, and the broader enterprise architecture. You will work alongside Solution Architects, Enterprise Architects, and System Architects to define, optimize, and evolve our technology landscape while ensuring alignment with enterprise-wide strategies. Your role will bridge employee experience with other architectural segments, enabling a cohesive and scalable ecosystem that supports business objectives across all touchpoints.
   

  

**Who You Are**
**We are looking for people with..**
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields. Certifications in Enterprise Architecture frameworks (TOGAF) are a plus.
* 15+ years of experience in software engineering, business technology, or related roles, with 10+ years in a Solution or Enterprise Architecture capacity.
* 5+ years of experience in multiple segments, preferably within Retail/B2C industry.
* Experience working with business & tech stakeholders, using EA tools like LeanIX for architecture documentation and visualization.
* Strong knowledge of HR technologies across talent acquisition, workforce planning, compensation, collaboration, and HR operations.
* Experience in AI, automation, data analytics, and RPA for HR processes.
* Toolchain for I IT Operating model, Portfolio management & corporate capabilities
* Proven track record in architecture governance, defining standards, and leading cross-functional initiatives.
* Experience in vendor management and strategic third-party relationships to drive HR technology innovation.


**Good to Have:**
* Experience in business strategy, operating model development, portfolio management, and HR transformation initiatives.
* Exposure to enterprise risk, security, and compliance management in HR systems.
* Knowledge of sustainability, health, and safety management technologies.


**LOCATION:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: AWS Cloud Platform Expert
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you an expert in AWS Cloud with a passion for designing, implementing, and optimizing cloud platforms at scale? Do you thrive in complex environments and enjoy driving automation and operational efficiency? We are looking for an AWS Cloud Platform Expert to join our team, playing a critical role in enabling Public Cloud adoption while ensuring a secure, scalable, and cost-effective cloud infrastructure.
   

  

**As an AWS Cloud Platform Expert…**
 You will take ownership of designing, developing, and implementing AWS cloud solutions that align with Telia’s cloud roadmap especially for enterprise landing zone setup, IAM, enforcing security guardrails, compliance and cost controls. You will lead cloud adoption efforts, staying ahead of the latest AWS advancements and evaluating their potential for driving efficiency and performance improvements. Your expertise will ensure the development of a highly automated, resilient, and cost-optimized cloud infrastructure.
   

  

 The role involves working closely with cross-functional teams and business units to align cloud strategy with operational needs, ensuring seamless integration of AWS services into existing platforms. You will focus on automation to enhance cloud operations, security configurations, and account management while optimizing cloud costs. You will drive best practices, provide technical guidance for the team, and ensure compliance with security and regulatory standards. Your ability to translate high-level strategic cloud initiatives into scalable technical implementations will be key to success in this role.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For…**
 We are looking for a highly skilled AWS cloud professional with extensive experience in enterprise cloud architecture, automation, and cloud-native development. You should have deep knowledge of AWS services and the ability to design scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud solutions while ensuring operational stability. Strong problem-solving skills, a hands-on approach to automation, and the ability to collaborate across teams are essential.
   

  

 Your expertise should include AWS cloud architecture and best practices, with hands-on experience in infrastructure automation, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud-native technologies. You should have very good knowledge and experience with
 **AWS enterprise landing zone setup, AWS control tower, IAM, automation, terraform, native IaC tools, cloud security.** 
 A strong background in cloud security and cost optimization is required, ensuring compliance with industry best practices.
   

  

 Fluency in English (spoken and written) is essential, along with excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively across technical and business teams. Experience with other cloud providers such as Google Cloud or Azure, as well as knowledge of FinOps and cloud cost management, would be an advantage.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by 2025-05-28. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at muthu-meera.arunachalam@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Enterprise Sales Director Sweden
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Picture Yourself At Pega**
 Imagine leading a dynamic team at Pegasystems, where innovation meets excellence. As the Director of Sales (Enterprise) for the Nordics, you’ll be a pivotal leader and key addition to the Central (DACH & Nordics) Management team. Since 2008, Pega has been revolutionising the customer journey for millions, working with well-known clients in the region, leveraging cutting-edge technology. Pega is The Enterprise Transformation Company™ that empowers organisations to Build for Change® with groundbreaking enterprise AI decisioning and workflow automation solutions. This unique opportunity involves hiring and coaching a world-class enterprise sales team, developing pipelines, strategic planning, account management, accurate forecasting, and consistently achieving defined sales quotas within the MEDDPICC qualification framework.
   

  

**Meet Our Team**
 Join a team that is at the forefront of industry transformation. As the recognized leader in strategic business application by analysts such as Forrester and Gartner, we challenge companies to rethink their business models and empower them to become more efficient, smarter, and customer-centric.
   

  

 Our Nordics Go-To-Market team is centered around our Stockholm office. We work in a hybrid model, offering the flexibility to work from home, client sites, or at our Stockholm office, while regularly connecting with your team to achieve outstanding results together.
   

  

**What You'll Do At Pega**
**Lead, Inspire & Empower** 
 your team to reach their full potential by listening, empowering, and driving accountability through empathetic leadership. Foster a collaborative, high-trust culture of top achievers, emphasizing OnePega sales engagement and a strong learning environment.
   

  

**Drive Sales Strategy -** 
 Set sales targets and ensure pipeline and forecast accuracy. Demonstrate operational cadence and engage meaningfully with C-level executives to create value, drive commercial outcomes, and identify significant upselling opportunities
   

  

**Implement Strategic Partnerships:** 
 Develop and execute a Sell-With and Sell-To strategy by leveraging top SIs, MSPs, and consulting firms in the DACH region
   

  

**Hire, train, and coach** 
 new and existingSales Executive team members to master the MEDDPICC Sales methodology, develop compelling territory plans, integrating the best of Pega’s internal ecosystem (marketing, inside sales, legal, presales, etc.) for successful deal realization.
   

  

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Build effective working relationships with cross-functional GTM teams, including Solution Consulting, Delivery Services, Marketing, our Partner community, and the Pega Sales executive team.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. You are a natural coach and mentor, thriving in these roles. You bring to Pega a proven track record of sales and leadership performance, characterized not just by a network of C-level connections, but by a wealth of best practices and innovative approaches. You are humble, authentic, and curious, and you excel in a fast-paced SaaS environment.
   

  

**What You've Accomplished**
* BA/BS/Masters or equivalent work experience
* 12+ years of industry-related sales experience, including 5+ years of experience in sales management (minimum)
* Business or fluent Swedish & English expected.
* Enterprise SAAS and/or complex software transformation solution sales background
* Strong listening, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Ideally thought leadership on Cloud Modernization and AI Transformation.


**Pega Offers You**
* A rapidly growing yet well-established business with the world’s most innovative organizations as referenceable clients.
* A proven track record in AI, showcasing our deep understanding and continuous innovation in this field. We are recognized as leaders by analysts in emerging markets.
* A comprehensive portfolio of benefits and rewards designed to support and excite our team members.
* A culture that truly values flexibility, family, and learning .

title: Staff ML Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**
* Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products with a focus on online prediction.
* Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems.
* Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-deployment.
* Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Required:
   

  

 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
   

  

 Comfortable work with multi-cloud setup and experience with AWS or/and GCP and containerized environment like Kubernetes.
   

  

 Solid understanding of machine learning lifecycle and fundamentals.
   

  

 Expertise in Python.
   

  

 Familiarity with Terraform, GitHub and GitHub Actions.
   

  

 Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
   

  

  

  

 Bonus Qualifications:
   

  

 Experience with Vertex AI, specifically in online prediction.
   

  

 Experience with Cloud Run and Workload Identity Federation.
   

  

 Experience with kubeflow pipelines
   

  

 Experience with Triton inference server and TensorRT
   

  

 Understanding of data security and privacy regulations.
   

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Digital & Commercial Transformation Lead - Telecom
description:
*Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues both locally and around the world, reimagining what’s possible. In this role you will be part of building Public Safety & Critical Communications with deep expertise in telecom, connectivity, and mission-critical communications. We develop tailored applications and manage complex integrations to maximize the potential of technology. Join us and collaborate with the world's leading organizations to realize the full value of technology through innovative solutions.*
**The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced leader to drive digital and commercial transformation initiatives for leading telecom operators and public sector entities. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in commercial strategy, product portfolio restructuring, digital transformation, and consumer insights. This role requires a strong background in managing large-scale programs and working with multi-vendor ecosystems across BSS, ICT, OTT, and emerging technologies. Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Digital & Commercial Transformation: Implement digital strategies; transform B2B/B2C segments; drive go-to-market strategies; leverage analytics for commercial strategies.
* Program & Project Leadership: Direct large-scale BSS transformations; oversee FTTx network rollouts; manage PMOs for governance.
* Strategic Advisory & Innovation: Develop pricing roadmaps; lead feasibility assessments; advise on PPP models in public sectors.


**Your profile**
* 15+ years of experience in telecom, media, or technology consulting.
* Strategic Thinking: Expertise in commercial strategy and revenue optimization.
* Digital Transformation: Proven leadership in digital initiatives.
* Program Management: Strong track record in managing large projects.
* Industry Expertise: Deep understanding of telecom BSS, Smart Cities, OTT.
* Analytical Skills: Ability to leverage data for decision-making.
* Leadership & Stakeholder Management: Experience with C-level executives and regulatory bodies.
* Education & Certification: bachelor’s or master’s degree in relevant fields; certifications like in Program Management (PMP, PRINCE2) or Agile methodologies are advantageous.
* You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the telecom industry, including professional certifications in telecom technologies and BSS/OSS platforms
* Our Values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

 As a
 **Test Automation Engineer** 
 , you will play a pivotal part in defining, maintaining and executing automated test suites. You’ll join our autonomous and self-organized Cloud team and will be a key member in shaping and driving our adoption of automated testing and verification practices. Your work will help ensure the highest standards of quality, resilience, security and availability across our infrastructure and services. These support a complex, cross-platform suite of client applications used both publicly and internally.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll work with:**
* Taking ownership of and maintaining test suite definitions in collaboration with the team
* Designing, developing and deploying automation to new and existing test suites
* Setting the foundation and maintaining a mature, quality-first way of working, supporting the development team and other stakeholders in making choices for shared future success
* Taking a leading role in supporting & coaching team members in test practices, building a positive environment of collaboration and continuous, actionable and constructive feedback between peers
* Collecting and structuring data on test suite execution, yielding insights into quality metrics over time


**What we’re looking for:**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys working closely with others to solve technical challenges. We also believe that you have the ability to clearly articulate ideas, visions and plans effectively. You’re proactive and continuously seek opportunities to improve ways of working, contribute to new ideas and share knowledge that elevates the team.
   

  

 For this position, we’re looking for someone with solid experience in:
   

  

* Modern test automation practices, including stress testing of service and UI based testing of web applications
* Testing in cloud environments (Azure)
* Collaborating and working directly in software development teams, with a strong understanding of software development challenges and common pitfalls


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Microsoft Cyber Security Architect
company_industry: Information Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**Job Description**
 Som Microsoft Säkerhetsarkitekt kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i att designa och implementera säkerhetslösningar baserade på Microsofts teknologier. Du kommer även genomföra workshops och samarbeta med andra säkerhetsspecialister i teamet för att säkerställa våra kunders cybersäkerhet. I rollen kommer du bli en central nyckelperson i arbetet med att implementera SOC-kunder. Du kommer även få möjlighet att arbeta hands-on med de säkerhetsprodukter som vi på Fujitsu erbjuder.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa, implementera och underhålla säkerhetslösningar baserade på Microsofts teknologier.
* Arbeta nära säkerhetsspecialister för att säkerställa robusta och effektiva säkerhetslösningar.
* Genomföra Microsofts Säkerhets Workshops för kunder.
* Driva cybersäkerhetsprojekt från start till mål, inklusive migreringar och implementeringar.
* Implementera och underhålla SOC-tjänster med Microsoft som SIEM-plattform.
* Arbeta med incidenthantering, identitetshantering och molnsäkerhet.


**För att lyckas och trivas i rollen har du några av följande** 
 :
   

  

* Djupgående kunskap om Microsofts säkerhetsprodukter och tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av att implementera SOC-tjänster med Microsoft som SIEM-plattform.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft XDR och andra säkerhetsprodukter inom Microsofts ekosystem.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-säkerhet och Microsofts teknologier.
* Teknisk skicklighet och förmåga att föra kunddialoger om lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av PKI och Active Directory.
* Arkitektbakgrund inom IT-säkerhet eller närliggande områden.
* Relevant utbildning inom området
* Svenskt medborgarskap
* Flytande kunskaper inom svenska och engelska


**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, med möjlighet till hybridarbete
   

  

**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Vilka är Fujitsu?**
 Fujitsu är ett världsledande japanskt företag inom IT och kommunikation. Vår marknad bygger på närhet till våra lokala kunder samtidigt som vi har det globala Fujitsu i ryggen. Det ger oss möjlighet att erbjuda alla våra kunder en bred palett av kreativa lösningar samtidigt som det ger oss de rätta verktygen att vara en föregångare inom innovation. Fujitsu erbjuder en komplett portfölj av tjänster, lösningar och produkter – vi är en global partner i den digitala transformationen.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda?**
 Som medarbetare hos Fujitsu möter du ny och spännande teknik inom t ex Artificiell intelligens, IoT, Big Data, Hybrid IT och mycket mer. Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmiljö med flexibla arbetstider där du får frihet under ansvar att själv lägga upp ditt arbete i ett modernt aktivitetsbaserat kontor. Utöver det får du vara en del av en inkluderande kultur med stark sammanhållning samtidigt som du får se bortom tekniken och fokusera på den konkreta nyttan för våra kunder, för samhället och för miljön.

title: Senior Director Program and Alliance Manager
description:
*Take the next step in your career as a Senior Director Project & Alliance Management at Calliditas, a global leader in IgA nephropathy treatment. In the role you will lead their drug projects on a global level and act as Alliance Manager for in-licensed and out-licensed programs.*
*Calliditas Therapeutics was acquired by Asahi Kasei Corporation in 2024, and you will be joining at an exciting and eventful time, playing a crucial role in the integration process.*
**Tasks And Responsibilities**
 As Senior Director Project & Alliance Management, you will:
   

  

 Project Strategy & Leadership
   

  

* Define and lead the integrated project plan, ensuring alignment with product vision, development strategy, and corporate objectives
* Drive long-term project direction, including milestone planning, scenario analysis, and critical decision points
* Evaluate key risks and opportunities — scientific, clinical, regulatory, and commercial — to inform portfolio-level prioritization and investment strategies


 Project Execution & Risk Management
   

  

* Oversee day-to-day project execution across all functions — from preclinical development to regulatory submission and commercialization — ensuring progress against strategic and operational goals
* Manage the critical path and key deliverables, proactively identifying bottlenecks and enabling timely resolution through data-driven risk assessments and mitigation strategies
* Maintain a living risk management framework, with clearly defined risk triggers, ownership, resource implications, and pre-planned contingency actions
* Monitor project health metrics, including timelines, budget adherence, and FTE/resource utilization, and drive corrective actions to ensure delivery remains on track
* Ensure transparent, consistent communication across internal and external stakeholders through regular cross-functional meetings, governance forums and executive reporting


 Alliance Management
   

  

* Serve as Alliance Manager for partnered programs, ensuring collaborative success and mutual value creation
* Establish and manage joint governance structures, oversee compliance with contractual obligations, and enable transparent, aligned decision-making
* Cultivate trust-based relationships with partner organizations, resolving issues constructively and proactively


**Additional Responsibilities**
* Act as a senior leader in selected corporate strategic initiatives
* Support out licensing efforts and contricute to the evaluation of new in licensing opportunities


**Education, Qualifications And Experience**
* Advanced degree (BA/BS/MS/PhD) in Life Sciences, Technical or Scientific discipline
* Several years of pharmaceutical industry experience, with proven leadership of global multidisciplinary drug-development projects — preferably including smaller pharma environments
* Deep expertise in project management methodologies applied to drug development (time, cost, quality and risk)
* Comprehensive knowledge of all drug development phases, functions, and processes
* Demonstrated track record in alliance management with external R&D or commercial partners
* Fluent in English (oral and written)
* Exceptional organizational, decision-making, and communication skills
* Proven ability to motivate teams, drive results, and meet strategic objectives


**Start:** 
 Upon agreement
   

  

**Location:** 
 World Trade Center, Stockholm
   

  

**Salary:** 
 Upon agreement
   

  

 We review applications on an ongoing basis, so do not wait – submit your application today! If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our recruitment consultant, Camilla Witedal, at [email protected].
   

  

**About Calliditas Therapeutics**
 Calliditas Therapeutics is a commercial stage biopharmaceutical company focused on identifying, developing, and commercializing novel treatments in orphan indications, with an initial focus on renal and hepatic diseases with significant unmet medical needs. In 2024, Calliditas Therapeutics was acquired by Asahi Kasei corporation and the integration is ongoing with an exciting future and expanded pipeline ahead.
   

  

 Calliditas’ lead product, developed under the name Nefecon, has received full approval by the FDA and is commercialized in the US under the trade name TARPEYO®. The product is also after the approval by the European Commission and MHRA commercialized by our partner STADA under the trade name KINPEYGO®. TARPEYO/KINPEYGO® is the first treatment approved for IgA nephropathy by the FDA and EMA, respectively. Nefecon recently received full approval in China and is commercialized in China and some other territories under the name Nefecon® by our partner Everest Medicines.
   

  

 Calliditas is also evaluating setanaxib in clinical studies to address a variety of diseases, including primary biliary cholangitis (PBC), idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), Alport syndrome and solid tumors.

title: Talent Scientist
description:
As a pioneer remote-first tech company with a product that inspires people globally, we attract a huge number of applicants to our organisation. We have created a hiring process that is totally unique empowering our business based Hiring Leadership team to lead talent selection. Our Talent Science team ensures that our processes are effective and that the business is able to make the best decisions to select exceptional talent. This is an exceptional opportunity to join a team that is changing the way an organisation hires.
   

  

 Our Talent Science team has a mission to ensure that we follow objective, scientifically rigorous and efficient processes to select the very best new colleagues regardless of location, culture or background. We work closely with our key stakeholders to ensure that decisions are being made in the right way and that our hiring model supports the selection of world class talent, regardless of location, culture or background.
   

  

 As a Talent Scientist, you will work closely with these Hiring Leads to drive initiatives, automation and best practice whilst offering an expert viewpoint on talent assessments. This is not a recruiter position; it's about the science of talent and performance, raising awareness and insights across the business so that they are able to select the best talent available from our global talent pool.
   

  

 We have a number of mid-senior level openings in our team seeking the following:
   

  

* Passionate about how an organisation selects talent using scientific approaches
* Ability to interview candidates using behavioural interviewing techniques (competency based and psychometric assessments)
* Strong analytical problem solving ability to identify trends and patterns using R or Python, SQL, statistical analysis, BI tooling etc.
* An exceptional academic background including a Bachelors or Masters degree in a Psychology based subject
* A high level of personal organisation to work remotely and be effective


 Location: This is a remote position based in the EMEA region
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

 As a Talent Scientist you will:
   

  

* Drive talent analytics to provide our business with real-time insight, partnering with the business to help them move through their hiring processes efficiently.
* Conduct in-depth behavioural talent interviews providing considerable insights into motivations and behaviours.
* Build key relationships with global stakeholders to ensure we deliver against our hiring agenda, closely monitoring hiring activities, driving results and ensuring that there is consistency in our operational processes
* Drive data driven insights, making sure our decision making process is robust and supportive to inform our decisions.
* Consider our employer brand and how our interactions with a candidate impacts their experience
* Review and streamline hiring processes and tools to drive continuous improvement.
* Work with external third parties and platforms to ensure we maximise our return on investment.
* Bring a passion for diversity and inclusion, ensuring we remove unconscious bias from our hiring process and ensuring our sourcing strategy underpins this.


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An demonstrative viewpoint on hiring talent in the technology industry with experience working within an highly data driven People team.
* Passionate about how an organisation selects talent using scientific approaches with viewpoint on how to predict and measure hiring outcomes.
* An exceptional academic background including a Bachelors or Masters degree in a Psychology based subject.
* Strong analytical problem solving ability to identify trends and patterns using R or Python, SQL, statistical analysis, BI tooling etc.
* Exposure/appreciation of psychometric assessments, including interpretation.
* Experience of conducting behavioural, competency based interviews with the ability to train stakeholders and advise on how to get the best out of an interview.
* A high level of personal organisation and self drive to work remotely and be effective.
* Willingness to travel to company events 2-4 times a year, for up to two weeks each.


**Other Skills You May Bring**
* Experience in sourcing and headhunting with the ability to teach our senior leadership team how to hunt for industry leaders.
* Experience in statistical significance testing and experience in Bayesian inference and/or predictive analytics and ML.
* Exposure to the following tools: LinkedIn Talent Insights, Greenhouse, DISC profiling.
* Psychometric validity and reliability metrics


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala samhälle? Just nu söker vi på Atea dig som vill jobba som lösningsarkitekt med fokus på att bygga kundlösningar med ServiceNow som plattform. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som präglas av medarbetare som brinner för att bygga Sverige med it, medarbetare som tar personligt ansvar och sätter laget före jaget. Vi har kunderna och du kompetensen - låt oss bygga vidare på vårt vinnande koncept tillsammans!
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Teamet består av amibitiösa och erfarna ServiceNow-konsulter, säljare och leveransansvariga. Våra uppdrag består av projekt, konsultuppdrag, förvaltning samt olika typer av kundaktiviteter. Vi ingår i affärsområdet Information Management och i din roll som konsult på Atea får du genom laganda, personligt ansvar och ett brinnande engagemang möjlighet utveckla, etablera och leverera Ateas erbjudande för ServiceNow. Vi jobbar dagligen med våra kollegor inom ServiceNow runt om i landet där vi drar nytta av varandras kunskaper.
 



  





 Som Lösningsarkitekt på Atea arbetar du nära våra kunder tillsammans med dina kollegor i ett agilt och engagerat team. Du hjälper våra kunder på deras digitala resa genom att säkerställa värdet av kundens investering samt ansvara för design och implementation av projekt och förvaltningsaktiviteter.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter i rollen som Lösningsarkitekt är:** 



* Implementation av plattformen och olika integrationslösningar
* Ansvarar för kvalitet, kapacitet, tillgänglighet samt access och säkerhet för lösningen och dess eventuella integrationer
* Huvudansvarig för den processmässiga samt tekniska lösningsdesignen med fokus på hållbar utveckling av plattformen
* Rådgivning och problemlösning
* Utveckling av Ateas erbjudande inom området



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper. Vi ser att du gillar att arbeta i team och vill vara med att bygga laget. Du är självgående och har sinne för att hitta nya lösningar. Du uppskattar möjligheten att möta alla typer av kunder och arbeta i en varierande vardag. Du sätter höga mål för dig själv och söker aktivt utmaningar samt utvecklingsmöjligheter. Att aktivt och kontinuerligt dela med dig av din kunskap till både kollegor och kund är en självklarhet för dig.
 



  





 För tjänsten som Lösningsarkitekt inom ServiceNow ser vi att du har med dig följande kunskaper:
 


* 3-5 års erfarenhet av kravanalys, design, utveckling och implementation av ServiceNow- plattformen
* Omfattande förståelse och kunskap om nyckelteknologi som är relevant för ServiceNow-integrationslösningar och förmågor
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla integrationer, appar och mer komplexa lösningar
* God förståelse för ”on-prem” installationer av ServiceNow
* Flytande i det svenska språket i tal och skrift samt goda kunskaper i engelska



  





**Om Atea** 




 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
 



  





 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" - en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
 



  





**Kontakt & mer information** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Marcus Aleson, Konsultchef, via marcus.aleson@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
 



  





 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



 Atea vill vara The Place To Be och därför värdesätter vi de kvalitéer som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
 



**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!** 




*Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.* 




**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Agile Release Train Architect in Data Platforms & Provisioning at Handelsbanken
description:
*We are looking for an Agile Release Train Architect to lead the architectural work within one of our agile trains for Handelsbanken's shared data platforms. You will be responsible for the overall architecture and supporting the journey towards the cloud in strategic architectural matters.*
**Your Team**
 You will be part of the Agile Release Train (ART) leadership team, alongside the Release Train Engineer (RTE) and Chief Product Manager (CPM). You will also collaborate closely with the solution architects in the area, Business Owners, and the line organization's management team. The team is characterized by strong collaboration, where knowledge sharing and common goals are in focus. Together, we work according to agile principles, with our responsibility being to develop and maintain the Data Warehouse, BI tools, Data Governance platform, as well as to to develop the target data platform in the cloud. You will also be part of the architecture forum to find solutions together and share knowledge with other architects in the field.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As an Agile Release Train Architect, you will play a crucial role in shaping and developing our shared data platforms. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining the train's target architecture. You will lead and organize the architectural work within the train and ensure that initiatives are aligned with Handelsbanken’s enterprise data strategies and target architecture. In this role, you will collaborate closely with other architects and train leadership to define and implement long-term solutions that support future business needs and technical requirements. Furthermore, you will prioritize and drive key initiatives, ensure that development initiatives follow architectural principles and design guidelines, and manage architectural deviations. As part of your work, you will coach other architects and promote skill development within the architecture team.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Your Profile**
 We are looking for someone with extensive experience in senior architect roles, focusing on both on-premises and modern cloud-based data platforms, as well as the challenges of on-premises to cloud transformations. You have deep knowledge in the data domain, including enterprise data warehouses, data governance with metadata-driven methodologies, data modeling, as well as modern "lake house" architectures and BI tools. With technical expertise and a solid IT background, you have also understand the long-term management perspective. Prior knowledge of AI/machine learning workflows and an understanding of data mesh principles is definitely advantageous in this role.
   

  

 You also have experience leading other architects and business experts to ensure that architectural work is strategically aligned and of high quality. Experience with agile methodologies, preferably in large organizations, is important for success in this role. As we collaborate across the entire group, you need to be proficient in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written. Prior experience in the financial services sector is also an advantage in this role.
   

  

 As a person, you contribute to an inclusive work environment by embracing different perspectives but can make independent decisions when needed based on business needs and regulatory requirements. You naturally think outside the box to come up with scalable solutions. Since you will be working with many different target groups, it is critically important that you can adapt your communication and visualize proposed solutions a wide range of different stakeholders. You organize, document, and plan your work well so that you and others can follow it.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
**We Offer**
* A trusted and stable employer
* Exciting and challenging tasks
* Good work-life balance
* Career development opportunities
* Clear corporate values around social responsibility and sustainability
* Competitive package of staff benefits


**Contact details**
**Hiring Manager:** 
 Graeme Newcomb, graeme.newcomb@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**TA Partner:** 
 Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
   

  

****Union representative Finansförbundet:****
 Susanne Ahlberg, susanne.ahlberg@handelsbanken.se
   

  

****Union representative Akademikerföreningen:****
 Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se

title: Databricks Champion
description:
*At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 800 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!*
**Your role**
 We are now seeking a passionate and experienced
 **Databricks Expert or Champion** 
 to join our dynamic team in Stockholm or Gothenburg. In this role, you will play a key part in driving Capgemini’s data, analytics & AI strategy forward using the Databricks platform. You will work hands-on with the latest tools in data ingestion, ETL, orchestration, and machine learning, while also contributing to solution design, architecture, and customer engagement. This is a role for someone who thrives at the intersection of technology, strategy, and communication.
   

  

 Capgemini has a strong and close collaboration with Databricks and was named EMEA Partner of the Year 2024 – a recognition of our customer growth, joint engagements, and technical excellence. As part of our team, you’ll help strengthen this partnership and guide organizations in unlocking the full potential of the Databricks platform.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key part in:*
* Design and implement high-performance data pipelines using Databricks and Apache Spark
* Build and maintain secure data lakehouses and data warehouses in Azure
* Integrate AI/ML models into data pipelines using Databricks ML and Azure ML
* Lead solutioning and architecture efforts – from whiteboard to production
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data scientists, analysts, and DevOps engineers
* Participate in presales, technical workshops, and customer presentations


**Your profile**
 We believe you are a senior data engineer or architect with a passion for building scalable, high-impact data solutions. You combine deep technical skills with strong communication and solutioning capabilities.
   

  

 You have:
   

  

* Proven experience designing and implementing data platforms using Databricks, Apache Spark, SQL, and Python
* Several years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure, including services like Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, and Azure ML
* A solid understanding of data architecture, including lakehouse design, data modeling, and governance
* Experience working in presales, technical workshops, and customer-facing presentations
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions


**Databricks Champion – or on your way there**
 We are looking for someone who is either:
   

  

* An official Databricks Champion, recognized for their technical excellence and community contributions, or
* A high-level Databricks expert with the ambition and potential to become a Champion. With Capgemini’s support, network, and close partnership with Databricks, we’ll help you take that next step.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work
* hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We partner with names such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Databricks, which can equip you with valuable certifications in the latest technologies, if that is your ambition.


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: D365 F&O Release Manager
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**Job Title:** 
 D365 F&O Release Manager
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Define and manage the D365 F&O release calendar, aligning with business and technical stakeholders.
* Oversee deployment of code and configurations across environments (Development, Test, UAT, Production).
* Govern the release lifecycle by coordinating build, test, and deployment activities using LCS and Azure DevOps.
* Ensure all releases follow structured testing, including unit, integration, regression, and performance testing.
* Lead go/no-go assessments, risk reviews, and ensure rollback and contingency plans are in place.
* Serve as the single point of contact for release-related communication to all stakeholders.
* Coordinate cutover activities during releases and ensure minimal downtime during deployments.
* Maintain documentation including release notes, test evidence, and audit compliance reports.
* Continuously improve release processes by adopting CI/CD pipelines and automation practices.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
* 5+ years of experience in ERP release management, preferably within D365 F&O or AX.
* Strong understanding of Microsoft LCS, Azure DevOps, and D365 environment topology.
* Experience with managing releases in a regulated or audit-sensitive environment.
* Familiarity with ITIL, DevOps, and Agile methodologies.
* Excellent organizational, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
* Ability to manage multiple parallel releases and prioritize effectively.



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Microsoft certifications in D365 F&O or Azure.
* Experience in managing third-party integrations or ISV solutions in D365.
* Knowledge of automation tools or scripting in Azure pipelines.
